question: How are the legal, familial, and romantic storylines intertwined through the engagement of Roxie Daymon to Simon, Simon's obtaining a promise from Rose Simon, and Governor Morock's offer to arrange testimony for Roxie Daymon?
gold_answer: Roxie Daymon was engaged to Simon, Simon obtained a promise from Rose Simon, and Governor Morock offered to arrange the testimony for Roxie Daymon.
llm_answer:
The evidence shows that the legal, familial, and romantic threads are knotted together through three linked transactions:

1. Romantic → Legal  
   Young Simon and Roxie Daymon are engaged (Novel-47558_c_93).  Because of that relationship, Simon dictates a death-bed will that leaves his entire estate to her (Novel-47558_c_95).  The will therefore converts the romantic tie into a legal claim on the Simon fortune.

2. Legal → Familial  
   To keep that will from being broken, Roxie needs testimony that Simon was mentally competent.  Governor Morock—who drafted the will—offers to “arrange the testimony” for money (Novel-47558_c_110).  The same Governor has already helped Simon obtain a promise from Rose Simon (Novel-47558_c_57) to pose as the sole surviving Fairfield heir so that Simon could draw the $20,000 Fairfield deposit.  Thus the Governor’s willingness to fix evidence for Roxie is part of the same machinery he earlier supplied to Simon and Rose.

3. Familial → Romantic  
   Rose Simon is revealed to be Rose Fairfield, aunt to Roxie Daymon (Novel-47558_c_92-93).  The earlier scheme in which Simon secured Rose’s cooperation to “manage the business” (Novel-47558_c_57) therefore involved Roxie’s own family, even though Roxie does not yet appear to know it.

Consequently, the engagement (romantic) produces the will (legal); the will’s vulnerability forces Roxie to rely on the Governor’s corrupt testimony (legal), the same figure who once brokered Rose Fairfield’s complicity (familial); and Rose, the linchpin of that earlier deal, is Roxie’s kinswoman, binding the familial strand back into the romantic and legal ones.
